intro: Brachyscome readeri, commonly known as the Blue Mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its clusters of small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has a low-growing habit with silver-gray foliage that contrasts beautifully with its vibrant flower heads. It is often cultivated as a ornamental plant in gardens and landscapes due to its aesthetic appeal and drought tolerance. Brachyscome readeri thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it suitable for a variety of garden settings.
